list_definition.definition: to manage to avoid (punishment, disease etc)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She was lucky to escape punishment.

list_definition.definition: to avoid being noticed or remembered by; to avoid (the observation of)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The fact escaped me / my notice
His name escapes me / my memory.

list_definition.definition: (of a gas, liquid etc) to leak; to find a way out

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Gas was escaping from a hole in the pipe.

list_definition.definition: (act of) escaping; state of having escaped

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Make your escape while the guard is away
There have been several escapes from that prison
The explosion was caused by an escape of gas.
